metadata.synopsis: General dialog for the refugee leader - father of the refugee family who stayed in the merchant's house when he was away.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Talk to him either outside the merchant's house or at the refugee camp depending on state.

31.speaker: Ben Golewits
31.text: You did your good deed, but Torm's still watching you - don't disappoint him now.

46.speaker: Ben Golewits
46.text: The poncy prat who owns this place is long gone - so I think we can both agree he doesn't need it anymore.
46.context: NodeContext: A little bit pleased about it

47.speaker: Ben Golewits
47.text: Not quite sure why you stood up for us like that, but I won't say I'm not grateful. Thanks. And may Torm keep you.
47.context: NodeContext: A little confused but grateful

62.speaker: Player
62.text: One thing: stay out of the basement. It's not safe.
62.context: NodeContext: A little worried - but glad for the warning

37.speaker: Ben Golewits
37.text: We're much more interested in the beds and the pantry - but I'll make sure Cinta knows the basement's off-limits.
37.context: NodeContext: A little worried - but glad for the warning

49.speaker: Ben Golewits
49.text: Who are you? Some thug here to do that stuffed shirt's dirty work?
49.context: NodeContext: Wary; unsure of the player's intentions

67.speaker: Player
67.text: What exactly is going on here?

41.speaker: Player
41.text: I'm trying to help you - wait here.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: The owner won't mind if you stay - you have my word.

25.speaker: Ben Golewits
25.text: Your word? Well... if you're sure. And you're definitely not pulling my leg...

39.speaker: Ben Golewits
39.text: I don't know if it's your place to give us permission to stay here, but thank you. Really. My family needs this.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: Here - take this. You'll be much better off in an inn than waiting to get chased out of here. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
59.context: NodeContext: Clearly conflicted about the charity

38.speaker: Ben Golewits
38.text: I don't want to take charity from some stranger. But... I will. For the sake of my daughter.
38.context: NodeContext: Clearly conflicted about the charity

15.speaker: Ben Golewits
15.context: NodeContext: With some difficulty due to being conflicted about accepting charity

6.speaker: Player
6.text: You should leave - there'll be trouble if you stay.

66.speaker: Ben Golewits
66.text: I spend most of my life hunting things that'd kill you as soon as they looked at you and you're telling me about 'trouble'?!

21.speaker: Ben Golewits
21.text: I spend most of my life hunting things that'd kill you as soon as they looked at you and you're telling me about 'trouble'?!

36.speaker: Ben Golewits
36.text: But... you're right. I can't risk those people getting a hold of my daughter.
36.context: NodeContext: Calming himself for the sake of his family; resignation and a tinge of sadness when speaking about the kids

83.speaker: Ben Golewits
83.text: We'll get going as soon as we've got our things together.

18.text: Thanks for your concern, but it'll be safer for my family to have four walls and a roof over their heads.

85.speaker: Ben Golewits
85.text: Thanks for your concern, but it'll be safer for my family to have four walls and a roof over their heads.

20.speaker: Ben Golewits
20.context: NodeContext: Contemplative; he clearly anticipates an attack

2.speaker: Player
2.text: This is private property. You need to leave - or I'll make you.
2.context: NodeContext: Disbelief at the player's callousness

1.speaker: Ben Golewits
1.text: You're seriously gonna throw us out? Throw my child out?
1.context: NodeContext: Disbelief at the player's callousness

29.speaker: Ben Golewits
29.text: You're seriously gonna throw us out? Throw my child out?
29.context: NodeContext: Disbelief at the player's callousness

60.speaker: Ben Golewits
60.text: You're seriously gonna throw us out? Throw my child out?
60.context: NodeContext: Disbelief at the player's callousness

55.speaker: Ben Golewits
55.text: You're just as bad as the rest of them.

76.speaker: Ben Golewits
76.text: Don't worry - we'll go. May Torm split open that hard, blackened heart of yours some day.

44.text: You city thugs are all the same. I'll protect my family with my life if I have to!
44.context: NodeContext: Desperate bravery; will do anything to protect his family

45.speaker: Ben Golewits
45.text: You city thugs are all the same. I'll protect my family with my life if I have to!
45.context: NodeContext: Desperate bravery; will do anything to protect his family

50.speaker: Ben Golewits
50.text: What's the word? Can we stay?

63.speaker: Ben Golewits
63.text: Back again, are you? What do you want with us now?
63.context: NodeContext: Slightly wary (not sure of the player's intentions)

77.speaker: Ben Golewits
77.text: I don't like being cooped up inside, but it's what's best for Cinta - I'll make sure she knows you had a hand in it.

80.speaker: Ben Golewits
80.text: I see those animals are out of the picture - can we stay now, or are you going to turn on us next?

65.speaker: Player
65.text: Stay? What are you talking about?

22.speaker: Ben Golewits
22.text: The selfish ponce who owns this place was trying to hire some gang to throw us out - but it looks like you got rid of them.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: There's no one here to throw you out - I don't see why you can't stay.
3.context: NodeContext: Grateful - but also a little concerned

32.speaker: Ben Golewits
32.text: We will stay. For now. I just hope he doesn't pay anyone else to come sniffing round.
32.context: NodeContext: Grateful - but also a little concerned

17.speaker: Ben Golewits
17.text: Thank you - and may Torm keep you.

23.speaker: Ben Golewits
23.text: You're the first person in this city to have our backs. Thank you. Really.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: And you'd better be grateful for it.

51.speaker: Ben Golewits
51.text: I am. It's been days since my family slept under a roof - so thank you.

71.speaker: Ben Golewits
71.text: Oh. Well. Thank you. I think?
71.context: NodeContext: Somewhat confused; wasn't expecting to be told they could stay

64.speaker: Player
64.text: How did you end up here?

52.speaker: Ben Golewits
52.text: Same way lots of us did - trying to get away from the army of the Absolute.

69.speaker: Ben Golewits
69.text: If you had the chance to put a roof over your family's heads after being on the run for Torm knows how long, wouldn't you?
69.context: NodeContext: Matter of fact; expects the player to see where he's coming from

74.speaker: Player
74.text: No one's telling you to leave - have all the roof you want.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: I understand. Let me talk to the owner of this place - maybe I can help.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: I'm not interested in sob stories.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Look, this place doesn't belong to you - get out or I'll have to throw you out.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: I'm trying to help you - I just need to talk to the man in charge.
35.context: NodeContext: Still a little wary (but matter of fact)

26.speaker: Ben Golewits
26.text: Make it quick if you can - I don't like the way he's looking at us.
26.context: NodeContext: Still a little wary (but matter of fact)

5.speaker: Ben Golewits
5.text: Off with you, then! We don't need an audience, that's for sure.

84.speaker: Ben Golewits
84.text: I heard you talking about us - you gonna kick my little girl out onto the streets, are you?
84.context: NodeContext: Angry; worried about his family and defensive of them
